title: How to Find Your Tram
en: Use the PTV Journey Planner or TramTracker app to find your tram. Enter your location and destination to see real-time arrivals. This helps you plan the best route for your trip.

title: Check Tram Route Number
en: At the tram stop, confirm the route number and destination shown on the tram. Make sure you are waiting for the correct tram. This helps you board the right service for your journey.

title: Free Tram Zone Rules
en: Inside Melbourne’s Free Tram Zone, you don’t need to touch on with your Myki card. Outside the zone, you must touch on before boarding. These rules help you avoid unnecessary charges and fines.

title: Boarding the Tram
en: Board the tram when it is safe and stand clear of the doors. Hold a rail if you are standing during your trip. This helps keep you safe while travelling.

title: Touching On and Off on Trams
en: On trams, you don’t need to touch off at the end of your journey. Only touch on when you are outside the Free Tram Zone. This ensures you pay the correct fare.

title: Requesting Your Tram Stop
en: Press the stop button before your stop and wait for the tram to stop fully. This lets the driver know you want to get off. Always prepare to leave a few moments before your stop.

title: Getting Off the Tram
en: Alight carefully at your stop and watch for bikes and cars around the safety zone. Follow the signs to exit safely. This helps you leave the tram without accidents.

title: Printable Tram Guides
en: Official tram guides are available as PDFs in multiple languages. These guides explain how to travel by tram in Victoria. Download and print them for easy reference.
